data.title: Watch SNL Host Jonah Hill, Michael Cera Parody Her; Superbad Co-Stars Get Flirty I
data.meta_description: Jonah Hill was host of "SNL" last weekend, and his "Superbad" co-star Michael Cera made a cameo on the "Saturday Night Live" parody of "Her." Watch Jonah Hill and Michael Cera on the "SNL" spoof of Spike Jonze's film "Her," in the video clip below!
data.text:
Jonah Hill was host of "SNL" remaining weekend, and his "Superbad" co-star Michael Cera made a cameo at the "Saturday Night Live" parody of "Her."

Watch Jonah Hill and Michael Cera on the "SNL" spoof of Spike Jonze's film "Her," in the video clip underneath!

"Saturday Night Live" host Jonah Hill parodies Theodore Twumbly (originally performed by way of Joaquin Phoenix), who buys an operating device that learns his behavior in order to create the perfect significant other (voiced by way of Scarlett Johansson) in the Oscar-nominated movie.

Jonah Hill takes it to any other level on "SNL" and his very best significant other...is himself. Renamed "Me," the parody features Jonah Hill purchasing an OS who is largely himself. At the very finish, Hill's "Superbad" co-star Michael Cera shows up because the working machine in the flesh. Hill and Cera then get very flirty with every different in the hilarious cartoon.

Another certainly one of Jonah's co-stars made a cameo on "SNL" closing weekend: Leonardo DiCaprio! The "Wolf Of Wall Street" actor jumped on level throughout Hill's opening monologue, they usually proceeded to have interaction in somewhat banter.

"Remember when we were on set and I'd great really nervous?" Hill after all requested, regarding filming "The Wolf Of Wall Street" together. "Can we do the thing that we did every time? The thing that made me feel safe."

DiCaprio agreed and embraced Hill from behind as they reenacted the "flying" scene from "Titanic," with the long-lasting tune taking part in in the background, The New York Daily News experiences.

Check out the humorous spoof of "Her" underneath!
